description:
Oh my God this is the greatest hidden gem of the city. The small deli is tucked inside the first floor of a financial building, it reminds me of NYC!

The cashier / guy at the counter is super friendly. You place your order and they make your sandwich for you. That simple.

The sandwiches are other worldly. honestly idk how they make such amazing sandwiches, but they're the best sandwiches I've ever had. I got the Tuna Melt on Sourdough, my boyfriend got the Sutter St Special. I would fly back to San Francisco just for these fckn things. the ingredients are fresh and plentiful and you can choose the time of bun you want it on! They have like 6 different kinds, even lettuce bun. Price is pretty normal for SF standards, and you definitely get what you paid for! 

They were so good we ordered two more to go (the Apple & Pork Loin and Joe's special. I was so full from the first sandwich already but I had to try it and it was equally as amazing
author: Tina K.

description:
This is the place you pass by many times as you go to the dentist upstairs. Oh, I don't have time. It's so tiny. I'm late for my appointment, etc. 

It's a hidden gem. They are super fast, and make great sandwiches. I constantly hear people ordering the Sutter Street Special, so you must try it! They have a huge menu for a little cafe. The egg salad is very good. The ladies who work here are very nice, as is the owner, who is often making sandwiches. Secret: Order ahead.

Another secret: They have bubble tea. So skip the line at Boba Guys nearby and come here. Order a delicious sandwich and gelato (another secret).
author: Carol W.

description:
This cafe is wonderful. It is affordable and the food is fresh and delicious.

I got the smoked salmon bagel which was absolutely divine. It was super flavorful and was wrapped perfectly! My friends got the breakfast burrito and chicken sandwich. Both were excellent as well.

I will definitely be coming back here and recommend it to anyone looking for a quick bite! Great for both breakfast and lunch.
author: Jasmin G.

description: Bomb ass cheeseburger add bacon.   This place is a great go to. I'm a regular and I have to say this is one of the best burger places with a great bun.  Mentioning the stamp card and you get a free sandwich after 9 stamps. Thank you for appreciating our business.
author: David W.

description:
Great spot for quick and fresh sandwiches, coffee, pastries and snacks. They have delicious breakfast all day. 

Southwestern sandwich is phenomenal! Ask for melted cheese/hot sandwich. The Dutch crunch they use is thinner than most other sandwich spots, which I really liked. Who needs the extra carbs 
Generous portions of meat and veggies in sandwiches. 

Great service. Joe, the owner, is polite, professional and fast.
author: Raisa G.

description:
Pretty good hidden lunch spot inside of the gold building behind the jewelry shop. It's never too busy in here during lunch, so it's a great stop for a quick work lunch. They also have a ton of other convenient snacks! 

The Sutter St. Special with prosciutto is a great, simple choice!
author: Hanna S.

description: Fantastic spot tucked into the lobby of the building. Great food, coffee, tea. I wanted to buy everything! Really great staff. Will be back.
author: L G.

description:
Wonderful cafe with great breakfast and lunch options. They offer breakfast combos that include coffee and lunch specials that come 
with soup. Veggie and Vegan options as well. Staff is great and I have to give a shout out to Carmen and Jo for always being so welcoming. I definitely recommend stopping by if you are in the area!
author: shayne c.

description: The word cafe misled me - I thought this was going to be a nice place to have a sit down lunch but it is definitely more pick up and eat somewhere else.  That being said the sandwiches are a great deal - you can get breakfast all day and for lunch there are so many tempting sandwiches.  I went with the southwestern and had a cold brew with it.  Service was excellent and we ate there.  I would definitely come back and get something to go.
author: Noa N.

description:
So good! Made a custom egg salad sandwich with arugula, avocado and bacon and it was delicious. Asked for extra crispy bacon and it was perfect. Cashier was super friendly and iced coffee hit the spot. Not a big place so grabbed it to go but would have been perfectly comfortable eating there. 

You have to go inside the 450 Sutton building. No signage on the outside.
author: Ryan V.

description:
We came here for breakfast based on the stellar reviews. It was fine but nothing to write home about. The impressive thing is that they put together whole hot breakfasts in such a tiny space. We sat at one of three tiny tables in the restaurant.

We ordered scrambled eggs with hash browns and bacon. Eggs were done right, bacon was thick and well done but not burned. Hash browns, however, were not individual shreds but more like a giant, flat tater tot. We also got a bear claw and a croissant. The bear claw was disappointing--softish dough containing a little blob almond filling--but the croissant was fresh, flaky, and quite good.

My husband's coffee and my decaf cappuccino were both excellent, and service was friendly. Overall this place is better for the grab and go customer than for a sit-down meal.
author: Patti I.

description: Good sandwich, great service, good price. The smoked salmon with cream cheese, capers, on bagel is really good.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Simple, out of the way deli with all day breakfast. Coffee is pretty good, food is exactly what you expect (simple but good quality) at a low price.

Inside the Wells Fargo building so can be a bit tricky to find
author: Ben Q.

description: I made my own custom sandwich for $10. It definitely didn't taste like a $10 sandwich. But I wanted to try something different since I work nearby and I was craving Luccas.
author: Lynn C.

description: It's okay. Came here on a Tuesday around 10am. There were only 3 other customers so my food was finished quickly. Tables are small. Food was very greasy. I wanted to try something different because I ate the same thing the past two mornings at Beanstalk Cafe up the hill. I'd rather go back to the other cafe. It's about a dollar more for an egg, bacon, cheese sandwich but better quality.
author: Sameyah M.

description: Had a delicious latte and egg, cheese, and sausage croissant breakfast sandwich here. Excellent value but this is a very small place in a building (and without a view) so it's tough to get a seat. It's a good grab and go option.
author: Shawn K.

description:
This review is for the Sutter St. Special Sandwich: prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, lettuce, arugula, tomato, extra virgin olive oil and 18-year old balsamic on a german pretzel. 4.5 stars. How surprisingly, delightfully, unassumingly delicious. 

Honestly, that's how I'd describe this small hole-in-the-wall shop too, hidden in the 450 Sutter Garage. So no excuses for anyone who says they can't find parking around here ;)

Everyone who works here is also so incredibly nice, and they also stock a pretty impressive selection of chips. Excited to come back soon to try some of the breakfast items and the Niman ranch pulled pork sandwich... that is, if I can resist not ordering the Sutter St. Special!

On second thought, I think the move would actually be to order half of each. No. Just one of each...Yeahhhh.....
author: Ashley S.

description: The location of this place is really peculiar so I went in feeling a little leery about eating at this place. I was pleasantly surprised! I thought the sandwiches were delicious perfect portion hot and yummy! My Ruben was really good and the sauerkraut had great flavor. I for sure would go back and eat there especially for the price in San Francisco
author: Nettifer W.

description: Great sandwiches, great customer service, (and great snack selection lol.) Free coffee and hash brown with your meal before 11.
author: sungheui u.

description: I had the organic egg salad sandwich on toasted sourdough roll. I have to say, it was the best egg sandwich I've ever had. The cafe was a little tricky to find. You have to go inside the entrance next to the Wells Fargo ATM.
author: Regie C.

description: This is just a little convenient store/cafe tucked between a parking lot and hotel. So glad I discovered it! I was staying at the hotel next door and was super convenient for a quick bite to eat. Best part is that they carry gluten free bread so they can make your sandwich with that if you ask. Really nice people.
author: Farheen A.

description: We went there for breakfast. It is a hidden gem inside an office building. The staff were very nice and helpful. The food was basic, but good quality and flavorful. There were nice touches like organic eggs.
author: Nancy A.

description: Got a recommendation from someone from our hotel so decided to try it out.    Ordered the Mac and cheese and the Sutter sampler(French toast and sausages).  The sampler was good, but the Mac and cheese was GREAT!   Good coffee and awesome spicy Bloody Mary.    Fast and great service
author: Tannaz B.

description: Be prepared to wait if you want to eat anything here. God forbid your on lunch break.. Today they completely forgot I ordered and so I waited an extra 20mnts for soup. Then I get yelled at by homeslice behind the counter,. He wasnt mean it's just how he communicates. Still very annoying.
author: Ingrid M.

description: Fresh, fresh, fresh....I tried the sutter street special and loved it.  My husband had the Roast beef special which was loaded with premium roast beef and topped with veggies. My latte was perfect with a rich taste and extra frothy just as it should be.  The place has a total of 10 seats but many customers take out.  Taking the line from Goldie locks and the three bears this place is just right!
author: Jessica B.

description: I did an order for take out and it was completed early. Very fast service, quick and polite. I ordered the black been veggie patty sandwich and it was very good and flavorful.
author: Vicky M.

description: I really liked this little place tucked inside an office building.  The employees were very friendly and helpful.  My bagel egg sandwich was very good and the coffee was piping hot.
author: Patrick H.

description: Hugely satisfying smoked salmon bagel, probably the best I've ever had. Served with a smile.
author: Martin H.

description:
Nice little place tucked in next to the parking garage. You can either enter through the Sutter building entrance and turn right, before the elevators and it's to your left or you can go through the side of the garage and you'll see a small sign that says "deli" above the doors. It has a few tables and counter seating so you can eat there if you choose, which I did. The full menu is listed clearly and the prices are definitely inexpensive. I got the Egg and Cheese Sandwich (with ham, eggs and cheddar in croissant) apparently, between the hours of 9am-11am (I think), you get a free hashbrown & a cup of joe with your order. 

I opted out of the coffee but definitely took the hashbrown. There are plenty of bottled juices, water and other non-caffeine beverages; they also have snacks, gelato with different flavors and etc. The staff are super friendly and the food came out quickly. They serve it to you if you choose to dine in and the place is kept clean so you don't feel grossed out when you're eating. Bonus points for playing old school music! Nothing like hearing Teddy P. or Marvin Gaye during breakfast. This is definitely a hidden little gem!
author: Candice J.

description:
I recently started working at the Color Factory just up the hill from this place and I always forget to bring lunch/dinner, and this place has been awesome and convenient because I can order ahead of time with yelp and pick it up during my ten minute break to have it ready for my thirty minute break. 

I love that it's hidden in a building and is small and cozy. It's got a nice ambiance that most cafes don't have. I feel welcomed and comfortable here unlike other cafes where you feel anxious by the busyness of other patrons and the hipster-ness of the decor.  

The chai lattes are so good and always at that temperature where you can finally sip a hot drink right when you get it. (I mean c'mon, this is just great attention to detail!) $3 for a 12 oz and a couple cents more for 16oz 

I get the vegan sandwich and it's tasty, the bread is also at the sweet toasted spot that I like. 

I also recently noticed they sell breakfast all day and the hashbrowns are $1.15 each, so I tried some of them, too. 10/10 

Honestly, I come here each time and order food thinking I'm going to spend a bunch of money on very little food and am surprised each time how cheap it actually is. 

I love this place. I don't know. It's worth my dollar.
author: Lyla P.

description: Hard to find, worth the effort. It's kinda in a parking entrance. I ordered the Sutter St Combo - outstanding!!!!!
author: Todd C.

description: Very small cafe located inside the 450 Sutter street office building on the first floor near the parking garage.  Appears to be a family owned business with only a few spots to sit.  When we arrived, we were very surprised by the size, but decided to give it a try.  I ordered the breakfast wrap (burrito) with an iced coffee - absolutely delicious!!!  The breakfast wrap was excellent - fresh, perfectly cooked egg, thick bacon, ham, avocado, and salsa - very tasty!!!  The iced coffee was as good as other coffee establishments.  My family also ordered the breakfast combos and pastrami sandwich - all were very, very good.  Very impressed with the natural taste of their food.  Staff was very pleasant and accommodating with our modifications and substitutions.  Looks like a place that probably gets lots of customers throughout the day that are heading to work and lunch breaks.  Will definitely visit again when in the area.  Highly recommended going, just not sure how crowded it gets during peak times.  We were lucky as we visited around 10AM.
author: Mike F.

description: Great quick breakfast and lunch sandwich shop. Small amount of seating so takeout may be a better option. Our group had three sandwiches and all three were on the mark and hit the spot.
author: Joe H.

description: Great atmosphere and good prices, very efficient staff who made changes to our menu choices on request.
author: AJ L.

description: The food was great and the customer service was great too. They were able to put together things that were not on the menu as well. Will definitely come back often. The AM Special was my favourite
author: Murad I.

description:
Everything I've ever gotten here has been delicious. This place uses QUALITY ingredients particularly for the price point. Reminds me of sandwiches my grandmother made, fresh and delicious!
The owner, Joe, and his wife are great and the staff is very efficient. Great small business to support and organic coffee too so I love never having to go to Starbucks!
author: Brian T.

description:
Secret cheap eats spot in Union Square!  I used to go to 450 Sutter all the time for dermatologist appointments years ago and never noticed this cafe.    I found it one day while searching on Yelp.  

I ordered a half smoked salmon sandwich for under $5.  While I was waiting for my order I admired the variety of snacks they offered for purchase.  After a few minutes it was done and I brought it back to the office.  

Sandwiches aren't like Little Luccas big but my half totally filled me up.  It had a fresh layer of delicious smoked salmon, light spread of cream cheese, tomato and onions on a baguette.  

I'll definitely need to try their all day breakfast sometime and salad.  Yay for cheap eats in Union Square!
author: Cat C.

description:
I have to confess that I only come here whenever I have an appointment with my doctor in the building and only if I happen to be in need of a quick bite before getting back to the office. I know that isn't a particularly compelling reason, but I think it says something that I'm willing to stick around 450 Sutter to get a sandwich when I should be acting more like a bat out of hell after seeing my doctor. It's a relatively modest operation although there are quite a few people who work in this tight space at any given time. It appears to operate as a combination deli and convenience store for those who know it's there - patients, medical office staff, parking lot attendants, lost tourists.

I usually come for the $7.99 Vegan Sandwich, which is well put together with lettuce, tomato, cucumber and artichoke hearts on wheat (photo: http://bit.ly/1meF6fM). I've never asked them what spread they use on the sandwich (i'm guessing a soy-based mayo substitute) but I like it a lot. When I feel a bit more indulgent, I go for their same-priced BLT since they use Applewood Smoked Bacon (photo: http://bit.ly/1QANQKu). These are not culinary creations of the highest order, but they do hit the spot when I need something fast. There are a couple of tables and a small counter if you want to eat in, but it crowds quickly so you may want to reconsider as several regular customers appear to hang out for long periods in here. This may be the Cheers of 450 Sutter.

FOOD - 4 stars...good sandwiches, well packed
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...definitely feels like a former pharmacy
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...usually prompt though a bit slower the last couple of times
TOTAL - 4 stars...you can't knock a solid vegan sandwich...even if they don't know my name
author: Ed U.

description: One of the best burgers in downtown SF. Hidden gem, small place though so not too ideal to dine in, but hey its a Cafe. Super good service from the owners who work there, deserves this review for sure.
author: Travis W.

description:
Very good breakfast place with tasted sandwiches. Nice coffee. Warm services. 
Small place, but a real gem!
author: Sunny Z.

description:
I was starving and craving a bagel and lox. After Yelping for places near work, I found Sutter Street Cafe. It's actually located in the same building as my eye doctor and dentist. Just walk into the building and make a right before the elevators. Then you'll see Sutter Street Cafe on your left. On Tuesday, September 29th around 10:15am, I grabbed take out for breakfast.

*Smoked salmon bagel ($7.50): with Gina Marie cream cheese, tomato, onion, capers on an everything bagel

When I ordered my bagel, the guy asked me if I wanted coffee and hash browns. I said no cuz all I really wanted was the bagel. But the girl that rung me told me they have a complimentary 12oz cup of organic coffee and hash browns with orders over $5.50 between 7am and 11am. So if you ordered something over $5.50 in that time window, grab your free coffee and hash browns. Once I realized they were free, I did!

For the price, the bagel had a good amount of smoked salmon. They also toasted it nicely and put a lot of cream cheese in it. The capers cut into the smoked salmon well and the tomatoes gave it a good freshness.

Great place to grab a bagel and lox in the morning. Just don't forget your free coffee and hash browns if you go between 7am and 11am!
author: Elena N.

description: Good breakfast, good price. Three little tables and a counter, this place is good for grabbing something to eat on the go or a quick touch and go breakfast. Coffee was pretty damn good. Strong like I usually make it. I had their #2 on the menu, 2 eggs, toast, and bacon (you get a choice of meat). Whole grain toast tasted good, bacon tasted good too and it was thick. This place doesn't stand out, it's tucked away next to a parking garage inlet with the entrance in a business building lobby so it took me a second to find it. I sometimes favor breakfast places like this that don't P.T. Barnum their presence.
author: Gerard E.

description: Very small cafe specializing in breakfast and quick lunch sandwiches. The service is quick and the workers are very very friendly and nice. The prices are totally reasonable and the food is good. I've focused on the cheeseburger with applewood smoked bacon and the price was reasonable and the burger solid. Good find overall.
author: Nick J.

description: Super tasty breakfast sandwiches and great coffee! The staff is incredibly nice. Only downside is the limited seating and lack of air conditioning. Get the bagel sandwich. You won't be disappointed.
author: Matthew W.

description:
The BEST tuna melts in the city!! Amazing amazing pulled pork sandwiches. The breakfast sandwich with has brown combo is so great too

Not a complaint for this place. My favorite in the area
author: Annie C.

description: Great staff, great sandwiches. I learned awhile ago its just easiest to call ahead an order 10-15 minutes before you want it. But hey they are busy being located right in 450 Sutter! those medical staff get hungry! They are the nicest though and the sandwiches all have a nice twist to them and all are really good.
author: Jessenotpatrick D.

description:
If you don't mind a small, cozy mom and pop shop hidden in a garage, it's a great place for sandwiches.  Try the Niman ranch pulled pork sandwich and you'll be back for me.  Service is friendly, fast, and helpful.  

If you're meeting someone, be sure to let them know the following:
- It's tucked inside a building and garage.
- Don't confuse it with Sutter Cafe at 300 Sutter St.
author: Jenny L.

description: stopped by for a quick breakfast and latte for my better half and it was excellent. had the salmon bagel, everything was very fresh and tasty and had a good portion of fish on there. awesome little spot tucked out of the way, escape the gross outside on beautiful sutter street haha, I am here all week for work, I think this will be my regular morning stop for the duration of the trip. very nice people working as well.
author: Baby J.

description: Amazing little Cafe. Fast, good good, great selection. Breakfast and hot food served all day. Gluten Free options, plenary grab and go options too.
author: L S.

description: Directions: Hard to find cafe with an entrance in the side of the parking lot, or through mysterious lobby entrance. I was drawn into this cafe on yelp because I was craving a cheap lox bagel in San Francisco- those are pretty hard to mess up. This cafe did the trick. I got a lox with cheese bagel, and it's not as cheesy as I am used to but it was filling. The bagel also didn't have capers but that's ok. The seating capacity of this cafe is literally 10 people, so it's super awkward to stay to eat. The bar is the least awkward, aside from the lamp being right next to your forehead. My overall thoughts of this cafe is pretty nonchalant; I will  probably have forgotten that I came here in a week.
author: Sabryna L.

description:
We had the Ruben and the house special sandwiches.
Lots of ingredients and serve at the perfect temperature.
The roasted pepper soup was super hot and yummy!!!
Awesome quick lunch:)
author: Amy W.

description: Great sandwich and tasty. I got the pastrami/salami combo. The soup and sandwich were very good.
author: zia h.

description: The Smoke Salmon Bagel is awesome...and they offer you free coffee and a free hash brown. Great food & excellent service!
author: T L.

description: Difficult to find but worth it. Very good sandwich and Thai iced tea for a great price.
author: Angela E.

description:
Food is pretty good but if you go there on your lunch break expect to wait AT LEAST 20 minutes before you get your order. 
I wasted my entire break waiting for my order and finally had to just ask for my money back. ..... after 20 minutes they hadn't even started making it.
It also doesn't seem to matter if you call it in ahead of time.  :-(
author: beth m.

description: BLT with extra crispy bacon and avocado on Dutch crutch. So freaking good! Perfect size as well. I also had the boba milk tea here the other day and it was excellent. The place is tiny with seating for about 10 people. Friendly staff!
author: Sam B.

description:
I discovered this place because I was craving a lox bagel. Saw it had good reviews so I decided to give it a try. It is easy to miss as it is inside of a parking garage. You can also access the cafe through 450 Sutter.

I really enjoyed the lox bagel. It definitely satisfied my craving. Also, if you spend over a certain amount during breakfast hours you receive a complimentary hash brown and coffee. 

Since their lox bagel didn't disappoint, I thought to give their lunch menu a try. Their southwestern sandwich is my favorite here. It's just the right amount of spicy for me. It comes on a soft roll but I usually ask to have it on dutch crunch instead.

Location is small so it can take a while to get your food if it's really busy. I usually try to go before or after the lunch hour rush to avoid waiting.

Friendly staff too!
author: Marycruz M.

description: All I wanted was smoked salmon on a bagel for a light breakfast and that is what I got! The guys here are so super friendly and just happy -- it was great! My salmon and bagel came in sandwich form so that was even better!! This is a very small spot -- not very fancy... but the food is good so you really can't beat that!
author: Sarath P.

description: Not sure why everyone raves about this place.  Food isnt anything special.  Mostly sysco type food.  Not homemade or anything.  Took 15 minutes to get 2 sandwiches and there was no line.
author: Marissa C.

description: Just a tiny little hole-in-the-wall, but everything here is quite delicious. My favorites so far are the Sutter breakfast wrap with ham, Swiss, and sun dried tomatoes, or the Turkey Cran sandwich. Such a nice little surprise to find right down the street from my hotel.. definitely made my trip that much nicer!
author: Jeramiah C.

description: Slightly better than an average deli.  I wouldn't go out of my way for this place.
author: Daniel P.

description: Great unpretentious little spot for breakfast and sandwich indulgences, as well as deserts and other snacks. I had the #1 sandwich, the Sutter Street Special, which was the bomb dot com. Very friendly and highly recommended if you stumble by.
author: Andy L.

description:
This is a family owned establishment that works very hard to do their best in creating a comfortable, clean and cozy space to serve their delicious sandwiches (spicy southwestern chicken is great!), coffees (double carmel macchiato's a favourite of mine!) and lots of little snacks to get you through your day.

It's best to order ahead to be the lines of doctors, nurses and other wonderful medical staff that regularly come here for their breakfast and lunches.

I highly recommend Sutter Street Cafe if you're looking for reasonably priced breakfast or lunch made by folks who are genuinely passionate about good service and good food.
author: Alacrity I.

description: Fantastic cafe - family run and friendly, efficient team, care about prompt service, excellent coffee, an excellent small cafe to cosy up for a conversation and catch up with a friend. In addition to sandwhiches etc they have all manner of snacks to go for little kids.  Discovered on accident.
author: Corinne B.

description:
I am not a vegetarian, but since I'm on sort of a health kick and I've been looking for some healthier/lighter lunches, I ordered the black bean veggie sandwich based on some other reviewers' recommendations.

It was very flavorful and the sandwich was maybe an inch and a half thick. Pretty good portion and a decent price (about $8ish after tax). While it was very good, it wasn't mind-blowing for a sandwich. It's your average sandwich, slightly better than average for FiDi, and at a slightly better price point. What would make them an amazing sandwich place is if they sauced it up a bit, provided a dill pickle with their sandwiches and served bread that wasn't toast slices but rather something... a little more interesting? Oh, and BTW - the black bean sandwich has got a little bit of spice in it so if you don't like a little spice you may want to stay clear of this one!

The cafe is nestled inside the 450 Sutter building (turn right after you enter). It's got a cool store of candies and snacks that come from Europe, which came somewhat as a surprise to me. It's a pretty decent selection though and I could see myself purchasing some European snacks the next time I swing by for a bite to eat.

Also, I don't know if they're just super fast or if I just happened to beat the lunch rush, but I was in around 11:45am and out by 11:50am. Pretty darn fast.
author: Joanne Y.

description: Found this little hidden gem on yelp! I was craving a delicious sandwich and this place hit the spot! I ordered the classic Reubens on a soft roll, was filled with sauerkraut which is the way I like it and plenty of cheese. It just so happens to be the sandwich of the day so it came with a cup of chicken noodle soup. I gave this place 4 stars because of the soup. I'm pretty sure it was Progresso canned soup or something close to that.  I wasn't expecting or planning on getting soup so I was fine with it. Just could have been better! Will be in town for 5 days, will probably visit before I leave.
author: Nicole S.

description: It is at the entrance of a parking garage only announced by a small chalkboard. I had delicious breakfast all 5 days of my stay in SF. Great Service also,  just a charm.
author: Diana C.

description: I had not visited this little hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop/cafe in about four years and did not know until today that there had been a change in ownership back in 2014. WOW! What used to be a last resort for a mediocre quick bite on the run before a dentist appointment in the building has been transformed into what will now be a destination lunch spot for me. Expect to find a thoughtfully-crafted sandwich menu served up by a genuinely nice owner and an exceedingly accommodating and gracious staff. Blue cheese spread and prosciutto/salami on a baguette? It sounded like such a weird and unlikely combination of ingredients that I really like that I couldn't resist giving it a try. It was absolutely amazing! They also serve breakfast all day. What a find!
author: William H.

description: EaterSF has made me a new fan of this place for great breakfast sandwiches!  I got the breakfast sandwich combo that comes with a hash brown plus you get a free small coffee (good coffee too!) from 7-11am if you spend over a certain amount (can't remember, $6.95?).  Not bad for a tasty, quick meal to get you going for the day.  I loved it, and can't wait to try other breakfast options there plus their lunch sandwiches (great variety from what I saw on the menu) as well. What a find!
author: Maile N.

description:
Based on reading Yelp reviews, I had a craving for a BLT and tried theirs.  It was pretty good.  My only recommendation is that they should use bigger pieces of lettuce as the small pieces they use tend to fall out of the sandwich.  I would go back for the BLT.

Based on that first positive experience, I then tried the vegan sandwich.  I specifically asked for the Dutch Crunch Bread to be toasted.  It wasn't.  On top of that, the overall flavor was just so-so, and not worth a special trip.

Finally, after seeing it mentioned a few times, I tried the Southwestern Chicken Sandwich.  Again, just so-so.  To provide the heat, they add several slices of jalapeno in the sandwich.

The people were nice.  Since it's a big building, they have a loyal and captive clientele.  However, except for the BLT, I haven't found a reason to go back.
author: Roy C.

description:
My husband and I got lost trying to find this place. Should we have looked for the address instead of following Google maps?  Yes, but it was too cold to think! 

This small café/deli/market is inside a medical building.  We wanted something quick and warm, so I ordered the sausage, egg, cheese on a english muffin.  My husband ordered a breakfast burrito.  Both dishes were made after we ordered so it was pretty "fresh".  Can't really go wrong with these breakfast staples.  They have a few seats inside their small restaurant.  

We saw many doctors, nurses, patients come in and out to grab something quick or their morning caffeine boost.  Place was clean and servers were nice.  Perfect place to grab something quick.
author: Rina L.

description:
This was only a few blocks from my hotel and I was pressed for time. The Yelp community seemed to give this place high praise, so I thought I'd give it a try.

Within the 450 Sutter building, it is actually called "Sutter Deli". I thought I came to the wrong place right off the bat.

The place is quaint and clean. I got the #1 English muffin breakfast sandwich and it was just fine, just what you'd expect.

However: the coffee was horrendous.

I'm not saying this just as a coffee snob. I believe to the average coffee drinker, it would not be up to par. Offensive, bitter, and acidic. 

I would not recommend Sutter Cafe, or Sutter Deli.
author: Jared O.

description: Adding one more star... This time I Stopped by for a quick breakfast. Very pleasantly surprised by their prices for a breakfast burrito which also included hashbrowns and coffee for only six bucks. Not the highest quality ingredients, but it was quick and you can't argue with price!
author: Rose R.

description:
The best hamburger ever. 
Breakfast and lunch menu are extensive
Specials every day with a cup of delicious soup
Prices are reasonable for the quality
Family run and they are so nice
Best restaurant in union square area 
Small but cozy
author: suzanne l.

description: The only thing keeping this gem from a five star review is the size and limited seating. A great option for an affordable and delicious breakfast just steps from Union Square in downtown San Francisco. The breakfast special features a meat, egg and cheese sandwich on either crossiant or english muffin with a crisp hashbrown patty and a cup of organic coffee.
author: Karen B.

description: Finally, a GREAT delivery place! Food is outstanding, no matter what you order... packaged thoughtfully so no mess if you order coffee/tea or any other type of liquid. Definitely making this place a regular in the rotation.
author: Mike R.

description: After three meals at this little place, I have to say 5 stars. The three orders were breakfast burrito (very good and satisfying), smoked salmon bagel (amazing) and smoked turkey sandwich (superb and filling - 7.50$). Excellent value for money, good ingredients, tasty coffee and a service with a smile. I really like them, and will be their regular customer going forward.
author: Balu V.

description: Food taste great small hole in the wall restaurant inside of the parking garage professional building. Can't see the side from the outside of the people are really nice food is really good. Get free Wi-Fi, great pastries and sandwiches and all day breakfast.
author: D A.

description:
This little hide-away rocks.
Breakfast sandwiches are great, price is great and the staff is professional.
Takes a bit of time to make up the food fresh and to order, but that just allows for more time to chill to the old skool jams or catch up on reading.
author: Tim O.

description: Good coffee place, but a bit hard to find! You'll have to take the entrance of a parking garage to reach the back of the building where the cafe is.
author: Julien B.

description: Great café that's hidden and out of the way. Prices are great for the quality and size of food and the staff are all very professional. Atmosphere is great if you're looking for some laid back solitude
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
Good coffee, various snack selections, food that is prepared tenderly & neatly, quality ingredients served in record time topped off with a smile. All these things you don't get from Starbuck's.

I was starting to believe that great customer service was OB SO LETE. 

Thank you.
author: Darth M.

description:
A little hideaway serving amazing quick grab and go food. A little sitting place is provided. 
Great service and reasonable prices. The breakfast is the highlight at this place. A long list of sandwiches with really great ingredients.
author: Zee R.

description: I was staying at Grand Hyatt and ate at their high priced restaurant.  Food was average at way over priced.  Found Sutter St Cafe and ordered online. Food was ready on time as promised and tasted delicious. Price was reasonable. Would definitely go back.
author: Don T.

description:
This tiny spot attached to a parking garage could be mistaken for a convenience counter in a gas station. But it's 3pm, people keep streaming in, and I just devoured the best sandwich I've ever had. 

The grilled bread has a delicate crunch, and my vegan sandwich has ripe avocado, crisp cukes, fresh arugula, yummy artichoke hearts, perfectly roasted red peppers (not slimy!) and savory hummos. Did I mention the bread? I can't belive I'm staring at an empty plate. My consolation is the refrigerator case of artisan gelato in the corner, and the case of fresh pastry by the register.

Seems I only review places I love, so I wanted to break the pattern and give Sutter Street Cafe 4 stars--but there is nothing to complain about. It's spotless, has all-day breakfast, and serves responsibly sourced ingredients. Doesn't seem fair to ding them for their size: only 3 tables (I was lucky to snag one) and only 3 counter seats. And the parking garage... it adds to the pleased-with-myself joy at finding this place.
author: Martha R.

description: I'm so thankful I found this place. The service was great, the man who took my order was super friendly and his customer service overall was excellent. I didn't get his name but you'll know him when you see him because of how good he is with handling a lot of customers in such a small space. My food and drink were brought to me. The waffle was excellent, their bacon was probably the best bacon I've ever had and the iced coffee was so delicious and refreshing. This place isn't expensive at all and it's definitely worth trying.
author: Sherry L.

description:
This is a great spot to get a delicious and light sandwich without paying an arm/leg for it in this area of SF.  Bread is very light and fresh.  I usually get the turkey cran sandwich -- the meat is tasty and I like the veggies thrown into it. They spread the cranberry sauce on both sides of the bread (top/bottom) which most other places don't do -- great touch. The staff has always been super friendly!

They have a fridge selling Fiorello's gelato which I keep trying to try but haven't.

As others have said, seating is limited, but you can grab a sandwich here and walk down 1 block to Union Square and eat in the sunshine.
author: Vadim G.

description:
Go inside the building and look for the small sign pointing down the side hall that says "Deli."

The little shop doesn't look like much, but this is the best f*cking smoked salmon bagel I've ever had.
author: Liam M.

description:
Love this little cafe. And hands down the best Tamales in the city. Chefs from all over San Francisco enjoy this delicious Tamales. 

Don't forget to ask for the amazing spicy sauce for your tamales!
author: Angel J.

description: Yelps rating got me here while I was visiting SF and I must say its right on!! Had a croissant egg breakfast sandwich and it was amazing! Their organic coffee was excellent and they are a very friendly staff. Highly recommend it if you're in the area for some breakfast.
author: Yasmin E.

description:
Found this place through Yelp. I ordered the smoked salmon bagel. I asked for an onion bagel, but got an everything instead. The bagel was supposed to be toasted, but could have been a bit warmer and crunchier. 

They give you a complimentary 12 oz coffee and hash brown with every order over $5.50, which was pretty nice. They were friendly, attentive, and fairly quick. 

Overall, it was a good experience, but I've had better bagel sandwiches.
author: Justin M.

description: This deli/cafe is on the ground floor of the office building I work at. They have everything here!!! Breakfast sandwiches, waffles, and really good coffee and tea. They're affordable, they give you a breakfast sandwich, hash browns and coffee for a little over $5. The owners/staff are extremely nice and inviting...always a good morning, good to see you. It's a really good way to start the day . Did I mention their sandwiches are crazy good.
author: Sergio L.

description: I work in this building and always look forward for having a delicious lunch at this place !!! Thank you so much delicious clean food ! Place is pretty small and cozy and more on the go food , but definitely my number one chose for a lunch !
author: Albina B.

description: This is one of the best places for a great sandwich and they are great people , so nice ask for joe to make it.
author: Daniel M.

description:
"Morning, could I substitute the coffee that's included in my breakfast order with a latte?" 
"No."
"hmm, OK. Could I substitute the hash Browns which are also included in my order with fruit? "
" No "
"Why not? "

Staring contest ensuses. 

'We don't do that. "
author: Tripp S.

description:
Not only is the location as convenient as it gets (located in lobby of my office building), the food is genuinely good, at a very reasonable price, and the staff is incredibly warm; not at all what I was expecting from a lobby coffee shop. They also offer a very extensive menu of beverages, food, and imported/high end candy. 

They also have nice loyalty programs like a stamp card, 10% off with gift card (I think), and a free coffee/hash brown with breakfast sandwich purchase.

I'm obsessed with the cold-brew coffee for only $2. It tastes so smooth and delicious, that I find myself visiting at least 2-3 times a week.
author: Christina R.

description: Awesome cheap eats right above Union Square.  Disappointed we didn't go here the first day in SF cause I would've had breakfast here everyday.  Beats Starbucks and all the other overpriced cafes right outside the door.  If your into all those overpriced, over-sweetened cups of melted ice cream at those coffee chains then this place isn't for you.  I had my cup of black java and a lox and bagel for under $8.  It's inside an office building and there aren't many seats but get yours to go and go down to Union Square and have breakfast.  We'll be back...
author: Kahai D.

description:
Great food, affordable prices and friendly staff.  I'm only in town for work so found this place on yelp that's near my hotel.  If you come here before 11 and ordered more than $5.25, you get a free coffee.  

The food was delicious and couldn't be happier for this little gem hidden in a building.

BTW, one of the entrance is in the parking garage.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Oh my goodness, how did I not discover this sandwich place earlier? I work about a block away and I'm definitely coming here again if I'm ever craving a good sandwich. It may be tricky to find- it's inside the 450 Sutter office building. I tried their black bean veggie patti sandwich which has arugula, avocado, lettuce, tomato, pickles, oil, mayo, and mustard on sliced whole wheat bread. They were nice enough to customize my sandwich and leave the oil out. For some sandwiches you can get a half order, but for this one you can't for some reason.this was definitely worth $8. This sandwich was delicious; I told myself I was going to save half, but I ended up eating the whole thing since it was so good. The bread was crispy, the patty was juicy and flavorful with a slight spice. 
I didn't know until I saw a paper menu on the table by the entrance that you can build your own gourmet sandwich using a variety of bread, meat, toppings, and sauces. 
They also have a good selection of salads, baked goods, coffee (organic fair trade!) and tea, breakfast and smoothies. 
I love on the menu, it says they use "sustainable farms, no antibiotics, no growth hormones, vegetarian fed meats on all their sandwiches."
This small cafe is packed with lots of goodies! Along the walls there are plenty of interesting snacks, chocolate, and gelato. My eyes were darting everywhere because there was so much to look at hahah.
There's not a lot of seats so it's a nice place for a quick grab and go. Lots of locals and medical workers in the building stop by here. 
To top things off, there is free wifi. :)
author: Anna L.

description:
Tiny, unpretentious, old-fashioned, friendly, delicious. All the previous positive reviewer's are correct. 

It is hard to find so look for it by the address as it is inside the lobby of an office building. 

I was tempted by some other reviewer's comments about the smoked salmon bagel so that's what I got, and it was great! 

To top it all off it is a great bargain - eight dollars for a toasted bagel with cream cheese tomatoes and lox with a hash brown patty and coffee.
author: Ron C.

description: The Southwestern Chicken Sandwich is on point- friendly staff and a great selection of snacks/chips.
author: Brian K.

description: Very good fresh and nice combinations for sandwiches. To stay or to go. You cannot come by coincidence, it is inside of a parking garage. Don't be reluctant to go inside it is worth it!
author: Frédéric M.

description:
From the looks of the place, you wouldn't expect the burger to be as amazing as it was. Hands down, one of the top 5 burgers I think I've ever had! My girlfriend's sandwich was absolutely amazing as well.

This place is a hidden jackpot!
author: Adam A.

description:
Great little deli for this area. Prices are appropriate.
The wait for a sandwich can sometimes be a tad long but the food quality is great.
I stop by for a Turkey Cran sandwich whenever I get the chance.
They also have free wifi!
author: Christopher S.

description:
So glad I found this little shop. I was in dire need of some sustenance before my plane ride and had no time to wait in line as is the norm in SF. I busted out my trusty Yelp app and found this adorable spot. It's hidden inside this giant building with a little sign that says "deli" pointing to it. 

When I walked in, I almost turned around thinking "ewwww another one of those pre-packaged sandwich places." This is not one of those. Their Sutter Special is proscuitto, fresh cheese, aged balsamic and your choice of baguette or pretzel bread. I chose the pretzel because I'm a sucker for pretzel bread and he made the sandwich right in front of me. No cellophane wrapped nastiness here. 

They've got a nice selection of bars, drinks, unique chips (spicy pickle!) and snacks. A great pit stop if you're in a hurry but don't want a typical salmonella sandwich.
author: Kelly S.

description: First and foremost, the staff members are polite and accommodating. The service was very fast and the sandwiches were simply amazing. I personally had the turkey cran, which was so delicious! Would highly recommend this deli!!
author: Paul J.

description: Friendly staff, delicious sandwiches made to order. Try the Southwest sandwich, it's my favorite!
author: E G.

description: I was walking back to work from my periodontist's office and wanted to grab a quick bite. I found Sutter St. Cafe on Yelp and decided to try it out after reading the great reviews. This place is a little hard to find initially, but there are signs that guide you to the deli from the entrance of the parking garage. I got the vegan sandwich, which had avocado, artichoke hearts, cucumber, roasted peppers, arugula, and hummus on dutch crunch. My sandwich was OK -- I thought it was a little bland. I wish there were some jalapenos, pepperoncinis, or pickles, although I'm sure that is possible if you ask. The dutch crunch was a little too chewy for my liking and wasn't baked enough. Although I wasn't wow-ed by my sandwich, I really appreciated that they had a vegan option on their menu! I am not vegan but trying to adopt a more plant-based lifestyle and it's great to see restaurants catering to all types of eaters. I also really like that on top of their menu, it states that they only use sustainably farmed meat with no antibiotics, no growth hormones, and vegetarian fed meats on all of their sandwiches. I'd definitely like to come back and try the other sandwiches.
author: Hana K.

description: Based on Yelp reviews, I placed a delivery order to our hotel. Arrived before expected time (35 mins!) coffee's still hot, food delicious. Our sandwiches were enough for lunch and dinner. Will definitely order delivery again and plan to eat in.
author: Lynn S.

description:
This little cafe is particularly cool because of it's placement in the Mayan Building; it's almost hidden.
I can't say that the cafe it's self is as beautiful but it's three tables do the trick. The staff is friendly and the food meets the criteria of a deli.
Good job, worth a visit.
author: Tommy W.

description:
I was staying in the Hyatt across the street and checked Yelp for nearby breakfast places - this turned up, and I'm so glad I did! I went there three times, twice for breakfast (the second time bringing three coworkers) and once for a sandwich.

The cafe, which, somewhat confusingly, is also called the Sutter Street Deli, is under new ownership as of some five months ago. It has a great selection of breakfast items, all made with fresh, and mainly organic, ingredients. On my first visit I had a "combo" with egg, cheese and bacon on rye toast, plus "hash browns". The combo was serve as a sandwich and was very tasty. I also had Greek yogurt, orange juice and simply wonderful coffee, rich and dark, just the way I like it.

The next day I returned and had smoked salmon on a bagel, with tomato, onions and capers. (I asked to hold the cream cheese.) As I expected, I got what I call a "California bagel", a bagel-shaped dinner roll. I have never found what I consider a real bagel (I'm from the northeast) in California. It was tasty, but not really a bagel. Nevertheless, the ingredients were all delicious. My companions had an omelet and some other egg-and-cheese dishes I don't remember exactly. Everyone loved what they got.

That afternoon I returned and ordered a sandwich to go and had a cup of gelato in the store. The gelato was very good as was the sandwich when I had it later. They even threw in a Zone bar at no charge.

The service was very friendly and courteous. The only "problem" I can mention is that because everything is prepared to order, and due to limited space they can make only one thing at a time, it can take a while to receive your order if they are busy. It will be worth it, though!

The cafe also stocks a wide variety of packaged snacks as well as teas, and they have some fresh fruit (I saw bananas and apples) as well.
author: Steve L.

description:
Perfect spot to wait for somebody with a dentist appointment. Hidden inside 450 Sutter, but it is far better than any chain coffee store. Good coffee and free wifi.

There's a reason why retail won't disappear (but lots of it will) and it's the neighborhood hole in the wall with great service like this cafe.
author: Patrick K.

description: This place is adorable! I found it through Yelp reviews and it doesn't disappoint. Staff are friendly, the food selection is perfect - not too much, not too little, customizable - there are shelves and shelves of gourmet snacks (and Quest Bars!) and it's inexpensive. The only downside is that because it's in a building, there's only a view of a hallway wall and the parking garage. But for a diner-like breakfast with snacks to go, I'd come back!
author: Isha T.

description:
Little and hide place but with a friendly service and good taste breakfast!
And the prices are great
author: Hilda P.

description:
Small cozy shop, great service and coffee was tasty than I expected.
I ordered turkey cran, must be good!!
author: Arisa O.

description: Great croissant and coffee and a great value. The service was excellent very helpful and polite. A little hard to find however worth the look.
author: Raymond H.

description: Ordered the vegan sandwich, said they usually use a bread that contains cheese. How is this vegan then????????
author: Jenny T.

description: It is a very small place but we got sandwiches to go and they were tasty. They have a variety of healthy choices and more options than just your basic sandwich. It is kind of inside the parking garage so easy to miss.
author: Jenny R.

description: High quality, delicious food at a great price.  LOVE this cafe!!
author: Erin M.

description: Breakfast here was delicious but the highlight was definitely the coffee!! I had a single shot cappuccino and it was perfect. Service was also great!
author: Gabriela V.

description: Love the south western and pulled pork!! Make sure you order ahead of time they get pretty busy!!
author: K A.

description:
I ordered the "southwestern" sandwich (#3), via eat 24, which was very easy. 

The sandwich was done in a flash. It was warm, soft, the ingredients were well balanced, and the size (regular) was perfect so as not to ruin the rest of my day with a food-coma (although since the deli is in a medical building, it would be an ideal place to be in coma). 

The service was patient, engaged, and quite chipper. I'll be back.
author: Farrell W.

description: I've come here twice and they make delicious sandwiches. Usually just get the daily special that comes with a soup. Also very reasonable price. Expect to spend about 7-8 dollars for a sandwich.
author: Danny S.

description: A great cafe! I've recently starting working at the 450 Sutter Building and my go to for breakfast is the breakfast bagel sandwich with ham, cheese and egg and it comes with a complimentary hash brown and coffee! They also have delicious salads, a variety of cold and hot beverages, and just all in all a good spot to grab that afternoon craving!
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
New favorite sandwich. Club with turkey and avocado. 

All i have to say is yum!
author: Bill M.

description: This place was hard to find because it's inside of a big building.  I expected a cafe with freshly made sandwiches and salads, but instead the salads came already prepared in a box...and it took them about 25 minutes to make a veggie sandwich for my husband.  Though he liked his sandwich, it definitely wasn't worth the extremely long wait.  P.S.  I didn't like my pre-boxed salad...so not worth the price.
author: Catherine C.

description: Eh. The Pulled Pork sandwich was hot and sweet but nothing spectacular. It's a small shop and maybe I ordered wrong. The iced coffee was pretty solid. A light and quick lunch for convenience.
author: Vaibhav V.

description: If you're looking for a no nonsense, affordable, non-chain and delicious place to eat this is it. This cafe has a ton of both healthy and yummy sandwiches, drinks, and snacks. The Reubens is delicious and a matcha green tea smoothie doesn't hurt!
author: Yoo-Jin K.

description: Great service! Hidden in the parking garage. Portions are a bit small but if you spend more than $5.50 you get a complimentary hash brown and 12 oz coffee. No waiting time.
author: Neisy H.

description: Great sandwiches, I tried not than sandwich and all was great .. I like the Turkey sandwich with avocado and jelpeno ... It's great ... The crowasen with cheese also great ... Really it's one of the best in CA .. The only thing I think that they need to get bigger shop with a proper entrance ...
author: Abdullah K.

description: Great food! Had lunch and breakfast here, while we were in San Fran! So yummy! Breakfast burritos are perfectly filling, and the lunch sandwiches are phenomenal! All of them! What a great experience! Especially for my first time in San Francisco! Sutter street cafe will definitely be on my list of things to eat next time I visit San Fran!
author: April M.

description: This was an awesome lunch place to stop at after a long flight. I was really hungry and used the great Yelp reviews to find a sandwich for lunch. Ye deli was really cute and the staff was friendly. I got the southwestern sandwich and it was great, but a little bit salty. I got the sandwich to go and then walked to union square to eat outside
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Great service and great breakfast. I came there with my husband to get breakfast. My husband got the breakfast combo which came with a free coffee and a hash brown. He liked it a lot. I got the salmon bagel with a hot chai latte. Everything was great especially the chai latte. Not even Starbucks can make it any better then them. In their cafe they had also snacks and chocolate from all over the world where I found my favourite German chips. Awesomeeee
author: Bianca C.

description: Stupidly good deli. Being from the east coast, it's hard to find a really good deli in California. This place is an exceptional deli with amazing food.  We tried the burger (which is amazing - steakhouse quality), the reuben (again, on point), and the pulled pork (which was to die for).  You can't go wrong stopping in here for lunch if you're in the area!
author: Mike W.

description: Avocado and cream cheese toasted cheese bagel - exactly what I was craving and great service (especially for vegetarians)!
author: Shonal T.

description: Awesome food at a good price. Cute little hole in the wall. Definitely would recommend!
author: Sabrina R.

description: OK in a pinch, but I would not return deliberately. Ordered the breakfast combo, which came with uncooked ham and a hash brown patty that looked like it was purchased from the grocery store. We came in based on the 4.5 stars, but I have no idea how they obtained that rating based on my experience.
author: Darlene S.

description: We were looking for a quick bite to eat while waiting for our room to be ready and stumbled across this little gem. Ordered 1/2 a Reuben on a sourdough and my husband ordered 1/2 Turkey Cran and both were delicious! The bread is amazing...slightly toasted, crusty on the outside and soft on the inside...ahh perfection! Super friendly guys behind the counter too!
author: Aulii R.

description: Hurray for this cafe's makeover.  Incredible food and coffee, wifi, nice music, clean space.  The perfect reward for arriving early for a doc appointment!
author: Maulie D.

description: Really good food. Honestly I walked in looked around and walked out . It didn't look like much and you had to go in a garage to get there.I ordered the Sutter special ( prechueto and cheese) , I order the pulled pork sandwich ( pulled pork with a grilled and buttered sourdough )and I ordered the Salmon and Lox bagel . Each were absolutely delicious I am grateful I rolled the dice and took a chance.
author: Ryan B.

description: Make the extra effort to find Sutter "Deli" in the Four Fifty Sutter office building. Just bear right after entering. The sandwiches are freshly made by a very accomodating staff. And they were great.  Also nice looking bakery items and lots of snacks.  Plus breakfast all day. Great breakfast or lunch option near Union Square.
author: Jay S.

description: Unassuming place tucked away in a garage, but extremely high quality ingredients and good service make this place a find. I've made a point to come here the last two times I was in SF.
author: Josh S.

description: Great quick breakfast! Fresh ingredients and very well priced! Loved the English muffin breakfast sandwich!
author: Raul V.

description: Amazing hidden spot. Top notch sandwiches. Friendly service who go out of their way to make you happy, etc. If they started delivering also then I would die of excitement.
author: Christopher B.

description: I love this place. I come here for lunch almost every day, and the days I packed myself my own lunch I'm kind of sad about it. All of their gourmet sandwiches are so good, and everyone is so nice! They know me by name and know exactly what I want, I've tried almost all of their sandwiches but I have a favorite (The Southwestern - it's so good!) Great quality affordable sandwiches and great coffee! :)
author: Alexandra G.

description: Hidden underneath all the medical offices is this great cafe. Convenient for those who have an appointment in the building. The owner is friendly and constantly busy. I usually get the smoked salmon bagel, which comes with a cup of coffee and hash browns. Perfect combination of salmon, Gina Marie cream cheese, tomatoes, and capers. The place does get pretty packed in the morning, so beware if you're running late!
author: Sandy W.

description: I just had the Black Bean Veggie Sandwich and HOLY AVOCADO it's amazing! I eat here regularly and the new manager has improved this Cafe greatly since taking over. The staff is alwasy super friendly and the only regret I have is not taking a photo of my beautiful sandwich before devouring it like Pac Man and white dots.
author: Chad M.

description: I work in the building and love the convenience of this Cafe. I heard that is used to be "not so good" but now under new management it is fantastic! I only know it to be fantastic...they're so accommodating to my sensitive food issues, if I bring them my own gluten free bread they will make me any sandwich I want,  they're so generous with portion size. The coffee is so good, the AM breakfasts are great, they gave me an extra hash brown to substitute the bread. The bacon is amazing! I highly recommend the BLT sandwich toasted :) very professional and friendly staff.
author: C T.

description: Wonderful customers service! Evergthing in the store is organic and high quality. tasty and healthy! Cafe owner had put a lot of his time and love to the cafe. Great start, keep it up.
author: Shirley N.

description: These guys are amazing.  Best sandwiches around.  Nicest people ever.  And, always some great Motown tunes playing.
author: Patrick K.

description: Considering all the other reviews, my experience today must be a fluke. I ordered 1/2 Niman Ranch pulled pork sandwich which tasted like pure sugar. I think someone must have spilled a sugar container in the pork or on something in the sandwich. I took another bite thinking maybe it was only on the portion I bit into - not so. I threw the rest out. I then went on to the 1/2 tuna sandwich I ordered. That too had a sugary taste to it but more concerning is that the tuna didn't taste or smell fresh. I'm disappointed.
author: Sandra P.

description: Dont go anywhere else in San Francisco for deli sandwiches.  This place caused me to create a yelp login. Fantastic sandwiches.  I had the Turkey Cran. Incredible/my favorite sandwich of all time.  I told the owner he needs to fix the signage in the building as it is difficult to find.  Making sandwiches like he does people should be lined up around the block. But it is quiet because it is hard to find.
author: Chris M.

description: I've worked a block from this place for 6 years and I never knew it was there! So glad someone told me because it's my new fave. Great tuna salad. I'll be back!
author: Stomparella J.

description: Hard spot to find as it's inside another building. Decent sandwich but nothing to rave about. Good for the price though.
author: Miranda M.

description: Super cool. Super chic store! Love, love the cool choices from chips to power bars. Great variety of drinks, desserts and sandwiches even gift items like tea pots, mugs, etc. And the decor and friendly service makes this place way better than any deli out there.
author: Maricar F.

description: Perfect spot to duck into for a freshly made breakfast.  My husband was on his way to his conference & we didn't have time for a "sit down" restaurant, so we chose the cafe based on reviews.  Our bagel sandwiches were pretty much perfect--they're not skimpy with the ingredients.  Coffee was hot & fresh (& free, along with the hash browns).  We sat at one of the little cafe tables & enjoyed watching the steady stream of fellow customers.  This place has a friendly, cheerful vibe!
author: Annie S.

description: Stumbled upon this cafe while attending to an appointment. Very nice shop, clean, friendly. I had their tomato soup and rocket salad, it was great, delicious. Good job guys. Love family owned businesses.
author: Ger L.

description: Everything I do in my life is very instinctual and in the moment. If I'm attracted to something, that's it. If I have reservations, those don't change till they're resolved. My first impression is how I go.
author: Bryan H.

description: The best burger I have ever had! Ever! I look forward to Wednesday burger special. The Sebastian breakfast sandwich is delicious too! I am so happy to have a lunch place near work with such good food.
author: Snoozie L.

description: We were staying nearby and wanted a reasonably-priced breakfast option and this was the winner!  It's a little challenging to find (you have to either go into the building lobby or cut through the parking garage) but totally worth it!  I had the bagel with smoked salmon sandwich and it was delicious - nice flavors, decent amount of filling, and what's not to like about free coffee? Quick and very reasonably priced. The only tiny drawback is there isn't really space in the cafe to eat - but you can walk across the street and eat in the square!
author: Beth T.

description: I work in the building, and am thrilled there is a place to conveniently get good food. They have great customer service, prices are reasonable, they appreciate your business, and they have a big selection of snacks and drinks if you want something small. Also, DELICIOUS gelato in the little fridge in the back corner.  Keep up the great work guys! :)
author: Kristen B.

description: Fast, delicious, friendly, good value!  Black bean sandwich was DIVINE!  Was in town just for a couple days and only had time to dash out of the hotel for a quick bite.  They are located past the fancy lobby in the inside of a cool old building.  Just a few places to sit inside, but I took my lunch to go so it didn't matter. Lots of other healthy snacks to choose from, too.
author: Mtn M.

description:
Really good sandwiches...So big you can save the other half for dinner. 
Tried the tuna and southwest so far and both are super yummy. Everything is super fresh and yummy made to order. Can't wait to try more things...The last place was a disgrace but the new owners have really turned this into something else.
author: My M.

description: I LOVE this place and the people who own it and work there. It used to be such a dive and awful place to go. Then, this guy fixed it up and made it "sing!" They really care about the quality of the food they serve and they have lots of variety. Great job!!
author: C. S.

description: What a great find. This place used to be crap......now fresh food. great coffee.....incredible assortment of chocolate
author: Kevin V.

description: The new owner have turned it around! Finally a nice Deli sandwich in the Historic 450Sutter building . The renovation is classy and the Sutter Special Sandwich is great! Highly recommend it.
author: Hamed J.

description: Excellent prices, huge portions, very friendly staff. One of downtown SF's great values.
author: Steve M.
